page.title: 15 School
page.content: The school was opened in September 1963, and was declared officially open by the Governor of Northern Ireland, his Excellency The Lord Wakehurst, on Tuesday 1st October 1963. The official guests included Sir Norman Stronge, Speaker of the N.I. House of commons, Alderman J.H.Smythe Mayor of Blackpool, Mr J.Harrison Chairman of the Education Committee, and Rev S.J. Warner Chairman of the school Management Committee. There were 125 pupils on the roll and they were taught by 6 full_time Teachers assisted by 1 part_time teacher. Of the teachers who were employed then 3 are still teaching at the school.
